newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korea approves second joint venture with North.
newsitem.headline: S.Korea approves second joint venture with North.

text.p: South Korea has approved a second joint venture project in North Korea, allowing Taechang Co to invest $5.8 million to produce mineral water, the national unification minstry said on Friday.
The only other approved joint venture is Daewoo Corp's $5.12 million investment in a clothing maker in North Korea's western port of Nampo.

Taechang's investment would give the South Korean textile maker a 60 percent stake in the joint venture with a North Korean trading company in the eastern province of Kangwon, a ministry statement said.
The venture aims to produce 76,000 tonnes of water each year. "The North Korean side was very aggressive in wanting to form the joint venture," the statement said.
Separately, the ministry said four companies, including LG Electronics Inc and Hanwha Co and two unlisted concerns, had been given approval to seek business opportunities in North Korea.
"Our government will seriously consider any further applications from local companies depending on the development of inter-Korean relations and North Korea's attitude," the statement said.
